etymologies: mid 19th century: from modern Latin Pardalotus, from Greek pardalōtos ‘spotted like a leopard’, based on pardos (see pard)

definitions: a small short-billed Australian songbird related to the flowerpeckers, typically having white spots or streaks on the dark wings and crown.

notes.text: Genus Pardalotus, family Dicaeidae (or Pardalotidae): several species

shortDefinitions: small short-billed Australian songbird related to flowerpeckers
